intro: Tabernaemontana fallax, commonly known as the dwarf star of Bethlehem, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the Apocynaceae family and is characterized by its striking, fragrant white flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant has oval-shaped, dark green leaves and a compact growth habit, making it suitable for container gardening. It thrives in warm, humid climates and requires well-drained soil to prevent root rot. Due to its ornamental value, it is often cultivated in gardens and as a houseplant.
